adjectives.description: infundibular (comparative more infundibular, superlative most infundibular)

entries.meaning: Having the shape of a funnel.
examples: Baconfield […] began to explore, first the blebs and blisters of that infundibular terrain, and then, naked as a worm and carrying a torch, the very catacombs themselves.

entries.meaning: (medicine) having to do with an infundibulum
